page.title: 18OLDER HOUSES IN CLOPHILL
page.content: One of the oldest houses is{Beadlow {Cottage.}It was built partly of old ship's timbers and has the date{1671 on an{inglenook fireplace. { Clophill House}is also{17c}but has had a{Georgian}front added. It was once a farm and also the mill house. The grounds are used for garden parties and have a{ha-ha}fence. { Ivy House}also has an added brick front to an older{wattle and daub, {wooden frame}building. The{Old Rectory}site was first used by the Church in{1428.}Most of the present house dates to{1850.}During the war it was used as a sickbay for children. { Brickwall Farm}is a{grade 2 listed {building.}It is the best example of a {"model" farm}in Bedfordshire. The older part is built of bricks made in the adjacent field in the{18c.
